website_summaries.verdict: Even for a full-featured megazoom camera at a low price, the Fujifilm FinePix S1500 delivers average photo quality and mixed performance.
cons: Picture quality drops off above ISO 200

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera originally back in 09 whn it came out. We took marvelous pictures in New York, DC, the Bahamas, Jamaica, California, I mean everywhere we travelled. It’s a beast! However I lost it a few years back and honestly haven’t had anything comparable to it. I went out in a limb and ordered it used from here. I really hope it works well and as intended. Will be very disappointed if not! Will update later
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Terrible outcome, completely worthless if you want to record ...
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint about this camera is the video recording part. If the subject of the video moves at all, the camera constantly refocuses... LOUDLY. The outcome is that you see a video, but all you hear is the grinding gears of the auto-focus. Terrible outcome, completely worthless if you want to record a meeting, a wedding, or any event that you actually want to record SOUND.
customer_reviews.author: Customer since Dirt was invented

customer_reviews.title: dumb. I had taken thousands of pictures on this ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a dynamite camera. I reordered it after I broke the battery door by dropping it a few times. Right...dumb. I had taken thousands of pictures on this and had fantastic results, just on 'manual' shooting. Of course, they no longer make this model. The upgrade I tried, with added powers, didn't measure up to this one. There still are some new ones of the S1500 out there - I recommend this camera highly. C
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia R

customer_reviews.title: Tiny dynamo !
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for my beloved S7000, and stumbled upon this. It is MUCH smaller than the S7000, but has twice the Mpixels & twice the optical zoom ! It took me a while to adjust to its size & slightly different arrangement or buttons, but I'm thrilled. The only things I miss from the S7000 are the adjustable viewfinder with cushioned hood (yes, I use a viewfinder, it is VERY bright here making view screens difficult to use well), and the AE-L (auto-exposure lock) button which I used a LOT. I'm still waiting for a true replacement for my S7000, but for the price this baby can't be beat !!
customer_reviews.author: GrammaNature

customer_reviews.title: BTW the vendor's software is pretty mediocre (but not as terrible as Canon's)
customer_reviews.text: In short, mine is a 'lemon'. It took me a long time to figure out that something is wrong with the autofocus; telephoto shots only focus under certain lightlng conditions. By the time I was certain, the warranty period had expired. Normal, wide angle, macro close ups and indoor flash usually come out 'good enough'. If the exposure isn't quite right, a little free computer software (Irfanview, GIMP) cleanup does the trick. BTW the vendor's software is pretty mediocre (but not as terrible as Canon's). My next camera will allow manual focus like the good old days of film SLRs.
customer_reviews.author: Emm F.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice amateur camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with this camera. I bought it so that I could take pics of my son's high school band during performances. One negative thing is the delay between focusing and taking the pic, sometimes I don't get the shot. Also, I don't like that the battery life isn't displayed on the LCD (maybe I could turn this feature on?). I should really read the manual though, I could learn something! All in all, I love my Fuji S1500! Also, it's $30 cheaper at Amazon and ships free... better deal than Walmart had and Amazon wasn't out of stock either (unlike Walmart).
customer_reviews.author: Toni BC

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: This was the lowest price ANYWHERE on the net. It is also the best value for your money. The quality of pix is outstanding; video quality is outstanding. Only problem -- if you can even call it that -- is that it is not exactly user-friendly. It takes awhile to learn how to use, but once you do, it's a snap. As far as pricing, I couldn't beat Amazon's price anywhere. This is a $200 camera, and I got it for $159. That's more than 20% savings! The camera is MILES above anything else I looked at. Non-pros like me can take professional-looking pix. Lots of cool features, and a smart-focus that takes the pressure off you! Buy it! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: E. F. Eisenhauer

customer_reviews.title: It's a winner
customer_reviews.text: I have used Fuji cameras for many years. This camera is a real bargain. WalMart has it for $30 more! The improvements in the camera operation and manual make this a good choice for the serious photographer who doesn't want to carry lots of camera but wants big camera results. It is very user friendly with all kinds of manual options to make it do way beyond point and shoot, but it can do it all on Auto if you don't want complications. Look inside my book, All Stories are True...Some Actually Happened, on Amazon to see the quality of the photos
customer_reviews.author: S. S. Otto

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Canon and Sony cameras/camcorders that were more expensive and not half as good. I also love the build in panorama feature. It may not be a shirt pocket camera, but it is still a small and light enough to carry it around my neck comfortably. I like the 12X optical zoom and the 10 mega pixels. It takes great video as well. The only thing I wish was that the self timer was a button I could push like it was on the FinePix s700, rather than something I have to find on the shooting menu.
customer_reviews.author: S. Linnemeyer

customer_reviews.title: camera
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter picked out this camera as one she would like to have as she enjoys taking pictures. It turned out to be just as she hoped and she enjoys using it. The only problem I had with it is that Amazon chose to send this product or had this product sent through the US Postal Service and I was expecting it to arrive by Nov. 20 as was the suggested date of arrival by the Amazon website, but it did not come until Nov. 27 which was kind of disappointing. I would, if possible, only use UPS and not the USPS for delivery. Other than that, the camera is great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K. Reynoldson

customer_reviews.title: A dependable, less expensive pro-type camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has both a large viewing screen and a direct through the lens type eyepiece, just like expensive professional cameras. The zoom lens works smoothly for viewing either way. The photos have been very good, even in less than ideal light. The flash is easy to use, and the batteries are easy to replace, and they are easily available. The photos download simply into my computer.It can also take short movies. The camera has settings to optimize for different subjects. I have found very dependable, with no quirks.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Somewhere between mediocre and good.
customer_reviews.text: The autofocus can be off target at times, the shutter response is often slow, and the images are frequently speckly in low light levels, but the reasonably wide zoom range and overall versatility make it useful enough to be worth the space in the travel bag. At this point, there are much better units around.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ault

customer_reviews.title: Really like the camera, and the service from amazon on this one.
customer_reviews.text: I'm early intermediate as far as photography goes, I use mine for taking artistic shots mostly, for the money I didn't find anything that came close to the features. I really like the picture quality, and the use is pretty intuitive. In the other reviews I found very few bad things, and I did have a problem with the zoom malfunctioning. One of the things that pleased me most about the purchase was that when I had the zoom problem with the camera, I received a replacement the very next day, which scored super high points for Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A. Mcdermott

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I have owned it since January 2010. It takes AA batteries so I never have to worry about my camera dying and can't do anything about it. Also, I use Lithium rechargeables that last a really long time. I've never had any quality issues with my photos. It fits great in the hands. I like that the flash only works when I pop it open. I cannot say enough.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, poor closeups.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few small cameras available with the electronic viewfinder (EVF), which I find much better to use than the LCD screen when outside. I would rate this camera 5 stars except its closeup capability is poor- I like to take pix of flowers, it rarely gets them right.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F. Mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Most bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: The Fuji 1500 was recommended by a former photography professor. It is more intuitive in scene recognition than other more expensive cameras and its 12x optical zoom is hard to beat. It does have that annoying attribute of most digital cameras that you have to hold the button down to allow it to focus, but the ease of use and other features make this a non issue. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: xragman

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the S1500 Fuji Digital Camera. It is a really good camera. It takes great pictures. My granddaughter Is a gymnist and we take lots of pictures. The features are easy to use.I had the model S700 before this one and I wanted one just like it I had great service from amazon.com. I didn't know we could order anything other than books from Amazon. The website was easy to use and I received it when you said it should be here. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Judes

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: amazing camera with wonderful features. I recommend reading the book before using it to get your full money worth out of this camera. Amazing photo quality as well. fast shipping as well
customer_reviews.author: Mikka Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to use too
customer_reviews.text: My daughter really likes this camera purchased for her graduation. Fairly easy to use too.
customer_reviews.author: teacher

customer_reviews.title: Compact and versatile
customer_reviews.text: This camera fits well in your hand, is loaded with many features and has a great zoom.I bought it for my daughter and son in law for Christmas and they are more than happy with it.You can't go wrong for the price.Unfortunately, unless you get a digital SLR there is that annoying camera lag when you take a picture. For those used to that this will not present a problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. Larson

customer_reviews.title: In this range of cameras (consumer mid-range) this is the best value!
customer_reviews.text: In this range of consumer cameras, the mid-range between the cheap digital cameras and just before the high-end DSLR/etc (what I call the "mid-range consumer cameras") this is possibly the best value-per-dollar camera based on my research. I own it and it's awesome... Other than the bundled software, but I get around that because all but one of my computers are Macs.
customer_reviews.author: Orcvader

customer_reviews.title: Fujifilm FinePix
customer_reviews.text: This a real good camera to start with. I am really pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Emmit Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera in a Small Pakage
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend this camera for anyone that is looking for feathers above a point and shoot camera. I have used the macro and super macro and enjoyed the results of both. Only thing I could say negative about this camera would be the owners manual on disk vs. in a book form, one other draw back(as I see it) is the lack of a threads to attach a filter to the lens. GREAT BANG FOR THE BUCK!
customer_reviews.author: D. Proctor

customer_reviews.title: great camera for Jewelers!
customer_reviews.text: I make and sell handcrafted jewelry so of course need photos for my website etc. This camera has a lense that will photograph within 1" or so. I get good detail. I also like it for a all around camera. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Zitschy

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Camera
customer_reviews.text: I began my travel photography in the 50's and have used many cameras, rangefinders, slr, p&s, and this one is one of the easiest to carry around and use. I am pleased with the output and the video option is quite nice. Recorded my grandsons' wrestling tournament and had quite acceptable video images. My single issue with this is the lack of ease with which to alter the output from the flash. I'm looking into a deflector or diffuser to soften the flash. It has plenty of output for most rooms. Overall, I am quite please and look forward to a long relationship with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: R.C. Black

customer_reviews.title: Something of a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very light and compact compared to other superzoom cameras (which is why I was attracted to it). Easy to use. Good zoom. Relatively inexpensive. "Burst mode" really is fast. Cons: Picture quality is very poor, poorer than some point-and-shoot cameras. To get halfway good pictures, I have to use the "Program" mode, and force the ISO to 200, and set the "Sharpen mode" to "hard." Autofocus seems less than accurate. Highlights blown out. Image stabilization seems ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: eagseags

customer_reviews.title: great camera and low price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a reasonably priced camera with viewfinder. The amazon endorsement made me feel comfortable with purchase. I like this product a lot. More than I expected in a used camera. It was is very good condition.
customer_reviews.author: snowpalak

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for just over a month. My son was graduating from eighth grade and my old camera broke. I was looking for a good zoom camera for the lowest price. I could not be happier. I took awesome pictures of my son's graduation. We went to an indoor water park the next day and I could not believe the pictures that I was able to take. The zoom worked great, the color was unbelievable and the action shots were spot on.
customer_reviews.author: MnMMom3

customer_reviews.title: Fujifilm FinePix S1500
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a replacement for my daughter. She loves it. Great price, great camera. The only mark against it, which may be what others are looking for, is that it used AA batteries. I would have preferred a rechargable battery. Other than that, it is an excellent camera.
customer_reviews.author: Debbra Ikeler

customer_reviews.title: I like this camera
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a ergonomic camera easy to use for my wife and with features similar to DSLR, I used to be a SLR amateur photographer and I am satisfied with this product, it was not so expensive, I have taken beatiful pictures with it. the only problem as many users had said, is the noise while you record a video, the video resolution is poor but is ok, I wanted a camera not a camcorder.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Camera review
customer_reviews.text: Took this camera on a recent vacation and got some great pictures of moose and bear. The stabilization feature keeps the objects in focus. The panarama feature is worth the cost of the camera. Manual features are numerous so the advanced owner can take varied shots in low-light, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Bourassa

customer_reviews.title: Best Bargain
customer_reviews.text: this is the best bargain on a digital camera that I have seen in a long time. I purchased it right before Christmas, Didn't really have a lot of time to play around with it before the big day. But took some great pictures anyway. It does take a little bit to get used to the different settings but that is with any new camera you purchase. I love this camera and I am very happy that I decided to purchase it, I would defiantly recommend this camera to anyone that is wanting a camera that is above the normal point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Burchett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: that camera is the best thing i bought,takes great pictures and videos
customer_reviews.author: Manuela OLeary

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for the buck camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a major upgrade from your point and shoot cameras, but is just as simple to use. Its compact size makes it easy to tote around. It also has alot of features that are fun to mess with. I would suggest this camera to anyone who wants to upgrade their camera and is on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Smabbles

customer_reviews.title: The camera is great, but the battery cover broke and is no longer useable.
customer_reviews.text: We had gotten this camera to take pictures at the aquaium and it did an amazing job the pictures and videos came out looking great afeter about two years the battery cover broke and we had to get a new one. The one we have ow has a rechargeable battery and i wis i would have gotten this one again it was so much better. And the price cant be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Warren

customer_reviews.title: nice camera but no bargain
customer_reviews.text: the camera itself works very well and takes great pictures. this is the third fuji for me. buying refurbished is not such a bargain, it came without a lens cover or strap. the cost of a new cover and strap are steep so if you buy them it brings cost of camera very near to new. will not buy refurbished again.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis I. Lauber

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good value and suits my purposes. Does not have a cable release. It takes one second delay to turn on and this is not reliable at times as it takes repeated activation before turning on. Taking a quick shot is problematic. It has many more features than I have use for but it has the ones that I need and does that very well.
customer_reviews.author: Coleman H. Waite

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera! Nice Price!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera - I bought it for the 12x Zoom and the 1.5 pictures a second continuous shooting. It does everything the description says it does. The only thing that concerns me is the "Zoom in" is noisy - but everything works the way it says in the manual. Also I use Mandriva Linux(instead of Windows or Mac OSX) - it is identified as a PTP USB Camera so gphoto2 and libgphoto2 can download the pictures to a PC running Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W

customer_reviews.title: Great camera and seller!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera from Jiki"s electronics through amazon marketplace. A great camera comparable to others that are much more expensive. I should also mention the above vendor was prompt and the item arrived in perfect condition. Would recommend this camera to anyone wanting to upgrade from the "point and shoot" variety. This camera's ease of use will make one feel like a photographer in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Gross

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this camera, Iam a amateur photographer and use it constantly. Photos are very clear and there are many options. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: sabra kelly

customer_reviews.title: This Camera Is A Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I found this Fugifilm Finepix S1500, with the features I wanted (10mp, 12x with IS and at a popular price)at Amazon.Com. I find looking at the back of a camera to be impossible when one is in very bright light. This excellent camera has a very good, accurate viewfinder, as well as a good back monitor. The size of the camera is also convenient for travel. I have a SLR with extended lenses, but it does not travel well. I expect the S1500 to be the last camera I buy. MBL
customer_reviews.author: Marion B. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: My Review
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for the price. Definitely up there in quality with the big dogs. Bought it for my 15 year old and it is glued to her. She likes it too much, if that is possible. Receiving this product from Amazon was another story. It took many tracking, phone calls and headaches to receive it 3 weeks after it was ordered. That is another story. In the end, I guess you can say that it was worth the delay. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Raye Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent camera for all i know about cameras which isn't much though i do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: william lowry

customer_reviews.title: Amazon customer service is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this to Amazon as all pictures came out with a green strip across center. Amazon customer service is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: larsmith

customer_reviews.title: Finepix S1500
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera to replace one I dropped. It was an excellent choice. Pictures have a great quality. Steady shot works perfectly in many conditions. I have enjoyed ease of use right from opening the package.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Schoenhofer

customer_reviews.title: Hoping for better quality
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement to an older Fuji I had. Unfortunately this camera does not have the same picture quaility that my old one had. The big zoom and high megapixels are great, but the pictures are very grainy. Video is also disappointing as the audio picks up noises from the camera focusing sometimes being louder then the sounds in the room. This camera makes me a little sad.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew G. Gobat

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this new camera a few times, but am very excited. Our children both own the same and they sold us on this camera. Thank you Fuji
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my euro trip and I can't complain about this camera, I took a lot of pictures, I bought duracell rechargeable batteries and the battery life was really long. Great camera!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Ma Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! We have not been disappointed at all with this purchase. I love that my pictures look so much better. The zoom is incredible. I love all the settings. It's easy to use. I love the continuous shutter feature...we have some great pictures thanks to it. Great value for all the features. You will not be disappointed with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L. Owensby

customer_reviews.title: Fuji s1500 camera
customer_reviews.text: Having owned Fuji gear in the past, we assumed this camera would last. Within two years the batteries would discharge within 24 hours of being installed. This regardless of the quality of batteries. It's cost us more in batteries over the past few months, than the cost of the camera. Suggestion, look at Sony camera's.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera to replace a FujiFilm S700. This camera is easy to use and takes great pictures under any condition. It is compact and light weight with great features. I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for a more traditional camera instead of a simple "point and shoot" digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Nipponkai

customer_reviews.title: Fuji Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had the camera a few weeks and am still learning all the features. It seems to be easy to use and the pictures are very good. If you are wanting to take quick speed shots this camera is a little slow. I would recomend this for beginner who wants good photos and an easy to use camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary M. Moody

customer_reviews.title: Great product - hands down!
customer_reviews.text: I tried out many cameras, Canon, Nikon and Kodak. I wanted a camera with good viewing area, easy settings and a good grip when handling. Got it all in this Fujifilm. Got great close-ups and excellent photo quality in a variety of lighting situations. Cannot comment on battery life - haven't had it long enough. It's not pocket sized, but light enough not to be a problem. For the money its a great camera - try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great....especially for the price that I paid for it. We use this on our Paranormal Investigations and were pleased with the quality of the pictures that came out. While I am not a camera expert, this seemed to be doing very good for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ingersoll

customer_reviews.title: Fujifilm Finepix S1500
customer_reviews.text: Good little camera! Great photos! The camera resolution is a bit high which allows it to take great photos. The only drawback is that with such a large format they take a while to download to an email.
customer_reviews.author: The Dutchman

customer_reviews.title: Lot's of features for a low price
customer_reviews.text: This was the lowest price camera that met at the requirements for a college photography class (aperture and shuttle priority primarily, and some other feature). Very happy with ease of use, picture quality and zoom. Probably is more than was a casual use might need, but if you want to start doing some creative shooting, it's a great camera to start with.
customer_reviews.author: John Lundholm

customer_reviews.title: FinePix S1500 is fine.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera from Amazon a couple weeks ago. So far I am very pleased with the overall picture quality. The only problem I have noticed so far, and it is minor, is the flash is too powerful for indoor close-ups. If you use a tripod or hold the camera steady, indoor shots come out ok with normal indoor lighting and no flash. The features offered on this camera for the price make it a great value.
customer_reviews.author: KenW

customer_reviews.title: Fujifilm Finepix S1500
customer_reviews.text: The Fujifilm Finepix S1500 is a good camera for the price range.I like it's durarbility,picture quality & it's easy to learn & use, also the zoom lens take excellent pictures.The only thing i didn't like was the software didn't download completely.For the money i'm please with my new camera.
customer_reviews.author: Pnthighnc53

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: I received the camera within a week. It was just as described with the original box and all accessories. It works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sammie

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This camera is easy to learn and use. I find the zoom all I would ever need;reminds me of the day I had a SLR with separate wide and tele lenes. And 10 megapixels for that price! Could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: A. Irvine

customer_reviews.title: Fuji digital
customer_reviews.text: Overall this camera is OK. Don't like the fact that the flash does not pop up automatically. Also, in auto, can't set to top color. The picture quality is good. It is not as fast as I had hoped when taking action pictures, but can live with that since I have a DSLR this is great for action shots.
customer_reviews.author: Addie K. Pressgrove

customer_reviews.title: camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is all that I expected it to be and more. I have owned a Fuji camera before and had it for several years. I was pleased with the old one and even more pleased with the new one. The auto scene recognition feature is a plus for me .I am not that familiar with different scene settings ,so having the camera adjust itself is a good feature for an amatuer.
customer_reviews.author: cecelia duncan

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Shopped around alot, looking for a camera that was easy to use and not too small. This was a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Herbst

customer_reviews.title: Dislike. It shuts off or dies on you even ...
customer_reviews.text: Dislike. It shuts off or dies on you even if you have new batteries
customer_reviews.author: Malibu

customer_reviews.title: Finepix S1500
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Takes a few tries to learn but then you get the hang of it. Be sure to get an SDHC memory card. The pictures are really good- the camera screen doesn't look as good as the pics actually do on the computer and printed out.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Duckett

customer_reviews.title: Okay Camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a Christmas present because my wife liked it. It takes okay pictures but the SD Card is in the battery compartment so each time you remove the Card the batteries fall out and you have to replace them, after finding them on the floor. The lock on access door to the batteries and the card is not easy to open with the slide type of lock. The SD Card should have been in another place with its own access door that is not locked.
customer_reviews.author: Phil D.

customer_reviews.title: Daddy's camera
customer_reviews.text: My father loves this camera. The setting are very user friendly. He said it was the best Father's Day gift ever.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Could Be Easier
customer_reviews.text: I've just gotten this camera so these comments may be a little pre-mature. So far the photos don't seem to be any better than my old Sony Mavica FD92 with only 1.6 mp and a lot harder to use. The memory don't hold much and the controls seem awkward. After I learn more about this camera I'll rate it again.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Sisk

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for everyday photos. I have moved on to more advanced picture taking but I really love it.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Love my camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought it a year ago, just now writing the review. We've always been Fuji people. Always loved the Finepix pocketcameras. Around Christmas last year, I dropped our 4 year old Finepix, being Christmas and expecting a baby, we definitely needed a new one. Seeing this one, being a Finepix, I was skeptical of the size, being a pocket camera guy. Absolutely love this camera, and for the price, it is a steal. Super easy to use, and takes absolutely great pictures. Great zoom too.
customer_reviews.author: David Roberts

customer_reviews.title: great.....
customer_reviews.text: this has to be the best camera that i have ever owned. for the price you cant beat it. i bought mine used and it looks new.
customer_reviews.author: postal soup

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for vacations/birding
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my Fuji Finepix S1000 after I damaged its LCD screen beyond repair. I like this camera because it is compact and has a lot of features. I love the image stabilization and 12x optical zoom for birding.

product_meta.title: Fujifilm FinePix S1500 10MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Dual Image Stabilized Optical Zoom (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER


In the tradition of the popular and well-received FinePix S1000, Fujifilm presents its successor, the FinePix S1500. This 10-megapixel long zoom digital camera offers great range and flexibility with a Fujinon 12x optical zoom (33mm-396mm equivalent) and like all FinePix S-series digital cameras, includes Fujifilm's Dual Image Stabilization and SR AUTO Automatic Scene Recognition mode to easily provide the best quality picture with increased clarity and sharpness, even in low light conditions. The FinePix S1500 also sports enhanced features like Panoramic mode, a Zoom Bracketing feature and full manual controls insuring the S1500 will keep up as your photographic skills develop. 

Automatic Scene Recognition
SR Auto (Automatic Scene Recognition) enables the FinePix S1500 to intelligently recognize six types of scenes automatically. For each picture taken in this mode, the S1500 will optimize the ideal exposure, focus, white balance and ISO for the scene to ensure the best quality picture is captured with ease. 

Dual Image Stabilization
Dual Image Stabilization is a marriage of mechanical sensor shift stabilization, to steady the photographer's hand, and Fujifilm's Picture Stabilization Technology, which uses fast shutter speeds with ISO high sensitivity, to prevent virtually all types of image blur. As a result, an increase in clarity and sharpness is achieved, even in low lighting conditions. 

Rounding out the FinePix S1500's powerful feature set is a large 2.7-inch high-resolution (230k dots) LCD, electronic viewfinder (EVF) and ISO levels of up to ISO 1600 at full resolution. 

Fujifilm's FinePix S1500 also offers the following useful features:

 * Full Manual Photographic Control: Photo enthusiasts and advanced photographers have total control with manual adjustment options for various camera settings including resolution, ISO, aperture, shutter speed and more. 
 * Face Detection with Automatic Red Eye Removal: Face Detection operates by identifying and prioritizing faces in a framed scene, and then adjusting the focus and exposure accordingly to ensure the sharpness and clarity of human subjects in the picture, regardless of background. After a shot is captured, each detected face is instantly checked for red eye. If it is found, it is corrected automatically, saving the time-consuming process of fixing it later. 
 * Instant Zoom: Instant Zoom makes it easy to frame and compose shots with moving subjects at high zoom settings. A selectable frame on the LCD screen lets you bracket and track the subject in standard wide view. When the shutter is released, Instant Zoom boosts the zoom ratio and captures only the enlarged area as a full-sized image, keeping the subject in the frame. 
 * Continuous High Speed Shooting mode: This mode allows moving subjects to be captured by shooting high-speed shots of up to 15 frames at 7.5 fps at 2MP and six frames at 3.3 fps at 5MP. 
 * Panoramic Shooting mode: Users can capture, combine and save a maximum of three consecutive shots at 3MP resolution each as a panoramic picture. 
 * Movie Recording: VGA quality at 30 frames per second with sound. 
 * 14 Pre-programmed Scene Modes: The FinePix S1500 features 14 pre-programmed scene modes that offer a one-touch setting for almost any situation. 
 * SD / SD-HC Compatible slot: A single media slot that accepts SD/SD-HC media cards. 
 * Operates on 4xAA Batteries: The ultimate in convenience and accessibility, using AA batteries means in a pinch, more batteries are just moments away. Four x AA alkaline battery power delivers 300 shots and up to 700 shots using lithium AA battery.
